result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer SMITH was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Janice and Brian Short, her apology letter can be forwarded.  

Submit DNA

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed.  If the defendant is not in residential treatment or Marco or terminated from the program, the jail will go into effect.

records.addlTxt:
Order Amending Bond.
It is hereby ordered the defendant's daily reporting to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department is no longer required and her bonds are amended accordingly.  All other conditions of her bond in the above pending matters remain in full force and effect.
Copy to jail.

records.addlTxt:
NO CONTEST pleas entered to counts 2 and 3, theft and criminal trespass to dwelling.  Convicted.
State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, burglary.  Motion granted.
Sentencing is set for 11-17-15 at 11:15 a.m.
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample.
Attorney Kerscher moves to delete the daily reporting condition. State has no objection.  Court grants motion.  Attorney Kerscher to draft the order.
Minutes.
Plea Date set for 11/5/2015 @ 4:00 in Br. 2

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 09-29-15 at 2:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Defense counsel asks for a modification of bail.   Court modifies defendant's bail condition to report daily to Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department in lieu of Two Rivers Police Department by 5:00 p.m. to test for alcohol or drugs at their discretion.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of burglary.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-31-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she report to the Two Rivers City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs, report to the Two Rivers Police Departmentto submit to DNA sample within 24 hours of release, report daily to the City of Two Rivers Police Department by 5:00 p.m. to test for alcohol or drugs at their discretion and have no contact with the residence at 1107 17th Street, Two Rivers, WI   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
